episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' features a variety of quirky facts and discussions, including the origins of pumpkin spice lattes, the peculiarities of sherry production, a baseball team's gravy-drinking superstition, and a Dutch tradition involving pancakes on heads.

facts.fact: When concocting its pumpkin spice latte flavour, Starbucks tried various ratios of pumpkin to spice, before eventually settling on 100% spice, 0% pumpkin.
When making sherry, it is important that you leave space for two fists inside your bunghole.
The 1894 Baltimore Orioles baseball team had a superstition in which every player would drink a glass of gravy before every match.
Every year, on November 29th, people in the Netherlands put a pancake on their head.
